text:
Drum-roll please! Review #100 coming right up! 

I chose to review Starbucks as my 100th review because it is a guilty pleasure. Something that I only allow myself once a week. But something that I crave everyday! 

This particular Starbucks is great. The baristas are always friendly and welcoming. The drinks are made correctly and quickly. I usually go with a Salted Caramel Hot Chocolate or Mocha. I also occasionally order the White Mocha. If you can't tell, I enjoy coffee that doesn't taste like coffee! In the summer their iced teas are the perfect thirst quencher! Their breakfast pastry items are always delicious. Try the Cranberry-Orange Scone and you will not be disappointed! Their breakfast sandwiches are unique and pretty tasty as well.

I always choose to go in and place my order over sitting in the drive thru. The line for their drive thru is always ridiculously long. It's usually quicker to go in!

evaluation.response: rewritedText: The author is writing their 100th review about a specific Starbucks location. They visit this place once a week, despite craving it daily. The staff at this location are described as friendly and efficient. The author's preferred drinks are Salted Caramel Hot Chocolate or Mocha, and occasionally White Mocha. They also enjoy the iced teas in the summer and recommend the Cranberry-Orange Scone and breakfast sandwiches. The author prefers to order inside due to the long drive-thru line.

Overall, the emotional tone, writing style, and linguistic characteristics suggest that the text is more likely to be human-written rather than AI-generated.

text: I stopped in to order take out and get a drink while I waited since it was happy hour. I've been here a few times and I have never been disappointed in the food or the service.

text: Urban South Brewery in New Orleans is the go-to spot for top-notch IPAs. Their casual and low-key atmosphere provides the perfect setting to enjoy some of the best brews in the city.
Quick, polite, efficient, and cost-effective service. Pleasant encounter with the gentleman behind the counter. Odd-shaped keys cut with no issues. Good experience overall.

My business, my parents, my ex-husband, my son and myself have accounts with this credit union. We have been with them for about 4 years and have been quite satisfied. With this many accounts and this many people there have been some errors however we go directly to the branch to have them corrected. So far that has worked out great for us.
Fantastic spot with amazing Sno-balls. Great all-natural flavors and super friendly service. Can't wait to go back soon!

It seems to me that whenever we have out of towner guests, our go to place is consistently Katie's. The variety of food wonderfully prepared is 2nd to none. Reasonably priced and delicious, Katie's never disappoints. Whether you choose the grilled ersters, the shrimp and grits, the Cuban sandwich, pizza, or soup & salad you will be very pleased and have a great meal. Daily specials hi-lite local seasonal offerings that keep things fresh. The service staff are warm and friendly. On Sunday's, you will want to time your arrival before church let's out or you will have a bit of a wait. That said, you can always manage while enjoying bottomless Mimosas!
Federal Doughnuts at the ballpark is a winning combination of doughnuts and fried chicken. Plus, gluten-free options near section 136 make it a great spot for all dietary preferences.
Good and fast service....meat is always very juice ....BBQ sauce is great...prices are reasonable...if you this truck around stop and try you won't be disappointed
Impressed with selection, delicious roast beef sandwich, long wait time, limited seating but community patio available next door. Excited to try their pizza based on good reputation.

Hands down best fall off the bone BBQ I've ever had.Excellent pulled pork everything had that great smoky flavor.Very creamy mac and cheese.Service was fast and friendly. Dessert was equally as good walnut brownie and ice cream delight.Such a great find.
Excellent service, quick repairs, and friendly staff. Fixed my bike's mangled front basket and gear shifter for free in less than 30 minutes. Couldn't be happier with my experience at this shop.

The beef noodles was a bit too salty and the fried rice was a bit oily. But overall they are good. We liked the shrimp spring rolls a lot. It is one of the best we have tried. 

The place could have earned higher points. But I have to give it a three stars because of the chaotic seating arrangement. The owner gave tables to people behind us despite we reminded the him and the staff. Perhaps that is what you get when you go to a teeny tiny Chinese restaurant during a long weekend.
Great happy hour deals, tasty drinks and delicious food. Cool atmosphere and open space. Will definitely return next time in Reno.

The Rib Cook-Off is a must-do event with easy transportation, great beer and food options, and helpful vendor navigation. Be sure to explore non-rib vendors and take advantage of cheap deals on Monday.
Great food and friendly service. I will definitely be back. Menu variety is great.  I had the Monte Cristo crepes, absolutely amazing
DO NOT STAY HERE. Dirty rooms, unhelpful manager, and overall terrible experience. Avoid Econo Lodge at all costs.

I came here because of the higher rating and they accepted my insurance. My initial visit went well, no complaints on the staff or the doctor at that time. 

They switched my brand from Acuvue to Air Optix and about 2 weeks after using the contact I started to experience pain, redness and irritation. I took my contacts out that evening and had red rings around both of my eyes. I tried contacting them via telephone and left a message as well as email, I failed to hear back from them in a timely manner so I reached out to them again and got ahold of them. I simply wanted my contacts switched back to Acuvue and they tried to tell me that it was allergies causing my problems and were insisiting on me keeping Air Optix. Eventually I did get them to agree to switch my contacts back to acuvue. 

In march I had another eye irritation and I went to Vanderbilt Eye Institue, they told me it was a continued reaction to the Air Optix lenses because I did not give my eyes enough time to heal before applying my new contacts - which was I was not educated on by Music City Optical when I got my new set of contacts. I then reviewed them on facebook at that time. 

Today (8/30/16) I recieved a response to my review on facebook and a corresponding email stating that I was being slanderous and lying, which was not the case at all. I was simply explaining my experience with Music City Optical.

Baguette Deli is an awesome spot for Vietnamese cuisine with delicious BBQ pork and fresh rolls. The staff is friendly and accommodating, and their bubble tea is a must-try. They are generous with jalapenos and the food is fresh and flavorful. Don't miss out - go now!

If I could select less than one star I would. Completely awful. After calling multiple times and no one answering, I finally was able to talk to a very unhelpful employee. He emailed me a specific unit, price, move in date and application. I filled out the paperwork but was unable to find the specific unit he indicated. When trying to call about my problem no one answered for 2 full business days. Then when talking with another very unhelpful employee, she told me that unit was already gone & suggested other units more expensive & not in the move in date discussed. When asking if they would honor the price originally discussed in email correspondence, they would not. Long story shorter, I cancelled my application & just wasted $50. This business only cares about money & does not care about the tenants at all.

If you're lucky enough to grab lunch at this spot between 11-2, you're in for a real treat! The grinder and southwesterner sandwiches were absolutely delicious, though a bit on the small side. Pricey but well worth it for the fantastic quality. Can't wait to try their steaks! Food and service both get a perfect 5/5. Price gets a 4/5 for being a little high.

Worst nail salon experience ever. The guy said "what is wrong with you" to a customer who accidentally chipped her nail. When I was explaining how I wanted my nails filed he told me to do it myself. Really bad job. Everyone was rude and does the job too quickly. You would think after having such bad reviews they would learn..

The atmosphere was nice and small. Very busy for brunch, expect at least a 30-45 minute wait. I recommend the spinach, caramelized onion and goat cheese omelet, but request a little less goat cheese. (this one was way too much, would have been better with 1/2 the amount).  Oh and the fruit was served perfectly ripe. Cash only.
